page.title: 15RECOLLECTIONS OF STAMBOURNE
page.content: { Written by an older resident who has {lived at Moat Hall Farm for 30 years.} (contd. from p. 14) The farm is down a chase but the house has long since gone. There were two cottages belonging to it beside the road. They were pulled down about 15 years ago. Further along on the double bend three cottages used to stand. They were partly pulled down, and a large house built on the site, which is there now called Old Robins. Beside Moat Hall Farm there is a bridle path which goes through onto the Finchingfield road at the other end of the village
